required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adaptation Of An HPV Education Resource To Promote HPV Vaccination
clinical_study.official_title: Adaptation Of An HPV Education Resource To Promote HPV Vaccination Among Unvaccinated Spanish-Language Preferring Latino Young Men Who Have Sex With Men In Puerto Rico And Florida

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to characterize Human Papillomavirus (HPV) and HPV vaccination knowledge, vaccine awareness, attitudes, health literacy, health beliefs, and intentions to receive the vaccine as well as educational preferences for learning more about HPV and HPV vaccination.

primary_outcome.description: Data from online survey will describe HPV and HPV vaccine knowledge, attitudes, health literacy, health beliefs and intentions to receive the vaccine as well as education preferences.

primary_outcome.measure: Facilitators and barriers to educational intervention (Aim 2)
primary_outcome.description: Data from in depth interviews with key healthcare stakeholders will inform intervention content and delivery methods and identify facilitators and barriers to implementation of an educational intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Feedback from focus groups
primary_outcome.description: Successful collection of feedback to complete HPV educational intervention. No statistical analyses are involved in this aim. Feedback through focus groups regarding the acceptability, accessibility, content, delivery preferences and aesthetics of the HPV educational intervention targeted for YLMSM.

arm_group.description: Unvaccinated Spanish-language preferring young Latino men who have sex with men (YLMSM), ages 18-26 (approximately 130 in PR and approximately 130 in FL) will be asked to complete an online survey.
Individual interviews will be conducted with key healthcare stakeholders (i.e.,healthcare clinical leadership, providers and staff, community-based organization staff)

4-6 focus groups with 24 young Latino men who have sex with men (YLMSM) (12 in each site) will be conducted to obtain feedback on the intervention, using an iterative process, whereby researchers conduct 1 focus group in FL and a complementary focus group in Puerto Rico and then revise the content based upon feedback from those focus groups, prior to proceeding to the next round of focus groups.

intervention.description: Aim 1 Participants will be asked to complete an online survey to identify knowledge gaps, health beliefs, attitudes, and educational learning preferences in this high-risk population.

In-depth individual interviews will be conducted with key healthcare stakeholders (i.e.,healthcare clinical leadership, providers and staff, community-based organization staff) to inform educational intervention content and delivery methods and potential facilitators and barriers to implementation of the educational intervention.

Focus groups will be conducted in-person or remotely to evaluate the newly created educational materials about HPV vaccination. 4-6 focus groups with 24 young Latino men who have sex with men (YLMSM) (12 in each site) will be conducted to obtain feedback on the intervention, using an iterative process, whereby researchers conduct 1 focus group in FL and a complementary focus group in Puerto Rico and then revise the content based upon feedback from those focus groups, prior to proceeding to the next round of focus groups.

study_pop.textblock: Young Latino men who have sex with men in Puerto Rico and Florida.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for Aim 1 & 3:
- Men who have had sex with a man and/or are attracted to men
- Hispanic/Latino ethnicity
- Able to read, write and understand Spanish
- Prefers to receive medical information in Spanish
- Has not received any doses of the HPV vaccine
- Primary residence in either Puerto Rico or Florida
- Has access to the internet
Additional criteria for Aim 3:
- Has regular access to a working telephone or be able to attend an in-person focus group
Inclusion Criteria for Aim 2:
- Participants who work for a community-based organization or private or public healthcare clinic that provides services to sexual minorities in Puerto Rico or Florida as either a healthcare provider or staff member or in a leadership role
- Age 21 or older
- Able to understand, read and speak either Spanish or English
- Access to a working telephone or computer
Exclusion Criteria for Aim 1 & 3:
- Self identifies as either transman or transwoman
- Age over 27 years
- Has received any doses of the HPV vaccine
